permissions.name: Manage Policies
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change events policies.

docs.summary:
Creates a policy.
 You can create up to 3 policies per event. If you try to create more than 3, you'll get the "Maximum number of policies for the event has been reached" error.

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of policies according to the provided filters and paging.

examples.title: Query policies by event ID and sort by created date in descending order

permissions.name: Manage Policies
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change events policies.

docs.summary:
Changes policy order in an event dashboard and agreement checkbox on the checkout form. By default, the policies are arranged by the created date in descending order.    
 > **Note:** It is possible to use both `beforePolicyId` and `afterPolicyId` at the same time but only the last one defined will be executed.

examples.title: Reorder Policies

permissions.name: Manage Policies
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and change events policies.

docs.summary:
Updates a policy.
 Each time the policy is updated, `revision` increments by 1. The existing `revision` must be included when updating the policy. This ensures you're working with the latest policy and prevents unintended overwrites.

examples.title: Update Policy

docs.summary: Triggered when a policy is updated.

members.name: entityId
members.doc: Policy ID associated with this event.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc: Whether this event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (e.g., GDPR).

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: entityId
members.doc: Policy ID associated with this event.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc: Whether this event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (e.g., GDPR).

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: entityId
members.doc: Policy ID associated with this event.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc: Whether this event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (e.g., GDPR).

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the policy is updated. To prevent conflicting changes, the existing revision must be used when updating a policy. You'll get an error if you try to use the previous revision.

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date and time when the policy was created in `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:sssZ` format.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time of the policy's latest update in `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:sssZ` format.

members.name: name
members.doc:
Policy name that is visible in the dashboard and checkout form.    

Min: 1 character  
Max: 40 characters

members.name: body
members.doc:
Policy body. Here you can enter various terms and conditions. Min: 1 character Max: 50000 characters Note: You can format text using various HTML tags such as `

`, ``, `

    `, etc.

members.name: eventId
members.doc: ID of the event to which the policy belongs.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load per page.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load per page.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.
You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: filter
members.doc:
Filter object in the following format:
`"filter" : { "fieldName1": "value1", "fieldName2":{"$operator":"value2"} }`.

**Example:**
`"filter" : { "id": "2224a9d1-79e6-4549-a5c5-bf7ce5aac1a5", "revision": {"$ne":"1"} }`

See [supported fields and operators](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-events/policy-v2/filter-and-sort) for more information.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","direction":"DESC"}]`

**Example:**
`[{"fieldName":"createdDate","direction":"DESC"}]`

See [supported fields](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-events/policy-v2/filter-and-sort) for more information.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: paths
members.doc: The set of field mask paths.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: subdivision (usually state or region) code according to ISO 3166-2

members.name: addressLine2
members.doc: Free text providing more detailed address info. Usually contains Apt, Suite, Floor

members.name: formattedAddress
members.doc: A string containing the human-readable address of this location

members.name: hint
members.doc: Free text for human-to-human textual orientation aid purposes

members.name: subdivisions
members.doc: multi-level subdivisions from top to bottom

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: a break down of the street to number and street name

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line (usually street and number) as free text

members.name: fullAddress
members.doc:
Full address derived from formatted single line `address`.
 When `full_address` is used to create or update the event, deprecated `address` and `coordinates` are ignored.
 If provided `full_address` has empty `formatted_address` or `coordinates`, it will be auto-completed using Atlas service.

 Migration notes:
 - `full_address.formatted_address` is equivalent to `address`.
 - `full_address.geocode` is equivalent to `coordinates`.

members.name: tbd
members.doc:
Defines event location as TBD (To Be Determined).
 When event location is not yet defined, `name` is displayed instead of location address.
 `coordinates`, `address`, `type` and `full_address` are not required when location is TBD.

members.name: scheduleTbd
members.doc:
Defines event as TBD (To Be Determined) schedule.
 When event time is not yet defined, TBD message is displayed instead of event start and end times.
 `startDate`, `endDate` and `timeZoneId` are not required when schedule is TBD.

members.name: timeZoneId
members.doc: Event time zone ID in TZ database format, e.g., `EST`, `America/Los_Angeles`.

members.name: endDateHidden
members.doc: Whether end date is hidden in the formatted schedule.

members.name: showTimeZone
members.doc: Whether time zone is displayed in formatted schedule.

members.name: timeZoneId
members.doc: Event time zone ID in TZ database format, e.g., `EST`, `America/Los_Angeles`.

members.name: showTimeZone
members.doc: Whether time zone is displayed in formatted schedule.

docs.summary:
Set of key-value pairs. Map of copied ticket definitions from original event.
 Key represents ticket def id in the original event.
 Value represents ticket def id in the newly created event.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

members.name: timestamp
members.doc: Event created timestamp in ISO UTC format.

members.name: derivedFromInstanceId
members.doc: Instance ID. Indicates the original app instance which current event was derived from.

members.name: derivedFromEventId
members.doc: Event ID. Indicates the original event which current event was derived from.

members.name: ticketDefinitions
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs. Map of copied ticket definitions from original event.
 Key represents ticket def id in the original event.
 Value represents ticket def id in the newly created event.

messages.name: _wix_events_v2_UpdatePolicySortIndexRequest

members.name: revision
members.doc: The revision of the Event Policy

members.name: sortIndex
members.doc: the sort index of a policy to set

messages.name: _wix_events_v2_UpdatePolicySortIndexResponse
messages.displayName: Update Policy Sort Index Response Object

members.name: policyId
members.doc: ID of the policy to delete.

members.name: query
members.doc: Query options. See [API Query Langauge](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/api-query-language) for more details.

members.name: beforePolicyId
members.doc: Move the given `policyId` before the referenced policy.

members.name: afterPolicyId
members.doc: Move the given `policyId` after the referenced policy.

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_SUBDIVISION_TYPE
  • ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_1 - State
  • ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_2 - County
  • ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_3 - City/town
  • ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_4 - Neighborhood/quarter
  • ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_5 - Street/block
  • COUNTRY - ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_0. Indicates the national political entity, and is typically the highest order type returned by the Geocoder.

Possible values are:
  • SCHEDULED - Event is public and scheduled to start
  • STARTED - Event has started
  • ENDED - Event has ended
  • CANCELED - Event was canceled
  • DRAFT - Event is not public and needs to be published

Possible values are:
  • ONE_TIME - Event occurs only once.
  • RECURRING - Event is recurring.
  • RECURRING_NEXT - Marks the next upcoming occurrence of the recurring event.
  • RECURRING_LAST_ENDED - Marks the most recent ended occurrence of the recurring event.
  • RECURRING_LAST_CANCELED - Marks the most recent canceled occurrence of the recurring event.
